title: SKILL GAP ANALYSIS - RESEARCH - SECONDARY DATA RESEARCH
company: PToL Impact Learning Empowers Private Limited
about: Work Scope in Skill Gap Analysis Secondary Data Based Skill Gap Analysis using secondary data means you analyze already available data government reports, census, industry surveys, employment exchanges, academic output, etc. instead of doing field surveys. Below is a professional work scope structure you can use in DPR, proposal, or government submission. 1 Understanding the Sector Geography Scope Includes: Identify district state industrial cluster Identify major industries MSMEs Map employment trends Review economic growth patterns Data Sources: National Skill Development Corporation reports Ministry of Skill Development and Entrepreneurship publications Rajasthan Skill and Livelihoods Development Corporation data Census of India PLFS Reports Industry association reports CII, FICCI, ASSOCHAM 2 Labour Supply Assessment Scope Includes: Population demographics age 1835 focus Education qualification distribution ITI Polytechnic College output Migration trends Unemployment rate analysis Deliverables: Labour supply estimation tables Youth availability projections 510 years 3 Industry Demand Assessment Scope Includes: Sectorwise manpower demand Current job vacancies trends Emerging technology requirements AI, automation, green energy, etc. Replacement demand retirementbased demand Data Sources: CMIE NSDC Sector Skill Councils State Industrial Development Corporations Job portal analytics aggregated reports Deliverables: Sectorwise manpower demand forecast Occupationwise demand matrix 4 Skill Gap Identification Core Work: Compare labour supply vs industry demand Identify: Quantitative Gap number shortage Qualitative Gap skill mismatch Future skill requirements Output: Skill Gap Matrix Sector Priority Ranking 5 Training Infrastructure Mapping Scope Includes: ITI, Polytechnic, Skill Centres count Private training institutes Capacity utilization Courses offered vs industry requirement Gap Identified: Course mismatch Outdated curriculum Capacity shortage 6 Future Forecasting 510 Years Scope Includes: Automation impact Industry 4.0 Green skills demand Digital skills requirements Local economic expansion projects Deliverable: Future skill demand projection report 7 Recommendation Framework Final Deliverables: Priority sectors for intervention Recommended new courses Upskilling strategy Apprenticeship promotion plan PublicPrivate Partnership model Budget estimation for training infra Final Deliverables in Secondary Data Skill Gap Study 1. Inception Report 2. Sector Demographic Analysis Report 3. Skill DemandSupply Gap Report 4. Training Infra Mapping Report 5. Final DPR with Recommendations 6. Presentation to Department Where This Is Used State Skill Development Missions Smart City Planning Industrial Corridor Planning CSR Skill Projects District Skill Development Plans If you want, I can also prepare: A detailed ToR Terms of Reference format A BOQ structure A DPRready chapter format A proposal document draft Tell me your target state or department Rajasthan, UP, etc. and I will customize it.

Regular technical reviews, architecture discussions, and progress evaluations help participants build strong engineering practices, scalable system design skills, and professional communication abilities. Collaborative project work also develops teamwork, documentation, and stakeholder communication skills.

about: METATAARAKA AI INNOVATIONS PRIVATE LIMITED DPIIT Recognized Emerging AI IT Company IIT Exclusive Long Term RD Artificial Intelligence Machine Learning Internship Program METATAARAKA AI INNOVATIONS PRIVATE LIMITED, a DPIIT recognized emerging AI IT company headquartered in Hyderabad, Telangana, invites applications from highly capable, research driven, and technically strong students from Indian Institutes of Technology IITs for a one year, fully online, long term RD internship program in Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning. This program is designed to work closely with MetaTaarakas core Research Development RD teams, focusing on AI agents, advanced AI research, AI powered SaaS platforms, and enterprise grade intelligent systems. As an AICTE Internship portal approved organization, MetaTaaraka maintains high standards of technical rigor, security, research integrity, and industry relevance. Internship Overview Duration: 1 Year Long Term RD Internship Mode: Fully Online Remote Weekly Commitment: Minimum 10 hours per week Monthly Stipend: 5,000 per month Vacancies: Limited Highly Competitive Eligibility Criteria Strict: IIT 4th Year B.Tech students OR IIT 2nd Year M.Tech students only. Candidates must have strong interest in AI research, applied AI engineering, and product development RD Focus Areas Responsibilities: Selected interns will work directly with MetaTaaraka RD teams on real world research and product systems, including: 1.AI Agents development and deployment, including autonomous, goal driven, and multiagent systems 2. AI driven SaaS product development, integrating AI into scalable business platforms 3. AI ML based eLearning content development, including intelligent tutoring systems and adaptive learning models 4.End to end AI pipeline development: data ingestion, modeling, evaluation, deployment 5. Contribution to enterprise AI components across MetaTaaraka platforms such as InsightCloud, CoreSuite, MarketSuite, HealthSync, and CommercePro 6.Integration of AI systems with existing business workflows, APIs, databases, and enterprise tools Required Skills Technical Competencies: 1. Artificial Intelligence Machine Learning Strong foundation in Python programming Understanding of machine learning algorithms, supervised unsupervised learning Knowledge of deep learning frameworks TensorFlow PyTorch Experience or exposure to: CNNs, RNNs, LSTMs Attention mechanisms and Transformer architectures Familiarity with Large Language Models LLMs, prompt engineering, and finetuning concepts Ability to evaluate models using appropriate metrics and experimentation techniques 2. AI Agents Intelligent Systems Understanding of agent based systems, autonomous decision making, and task orchestration Experience with or exposure to LLM powered agents, tool usage, memory, and planning Knowledge of workflow automation and AI driven process optimization 3. Backend Development System Design Proficiency in backend development using Python FastAPI, Flask, Django or similar frameworks API design and integration REST GraphQL Experience with databases: SQL PostgreSQL, MySQL NoSQL MongoDB, Redis Understanding of scalable system design, microservices, and asynchronous processing 4. Frontend Development Basic to intermediate experience with frontend technologies such as: HTML, CSS, JavaScript React Angular Vue any one preferred Ability to integrate frontend interfaces with AI powered backend services Focus on usability, performance, and real world product experience 5. Security Data Protection Awareness of application security fundamentals Secure API design, authentication, and authorization mechanisms Handling of sensitive data, access controls, and compliance awareness Understanding of AI related security concerns such as data leakage, model misuse, and prompt security 6. Cloud, DevOps MLOps Exposure to cloud platforms: AWS, Azure, or Google Cloud Understanding of model deployment pipelines Basic knowledge of: Containerization Docker CICD pipelines Model monitoring and performance tracking Familiarity with productionizing AI models in scalable environments 7. Business Integration Product Thinking Ability to align AI solutions with real business problems Understanding how AI integrates into existing business models and SaaS workflows Translating technical ideas into measurable business outcomes Documentation, reporting, and stakeholder communication Research Publication Requirement Interns must be ready and committed to publishing at least one research paper Publication target: UGC approved journals or conferences Research topics will align with MetaTaarakas RD objectives and intern project work Mentorship and guidance will be provided for research methodology, experimentation, and writing Preferred Candidate Profile Preference will be given to candidates who: Have completed any AIML related internship or significant project Demonstrate strong leadership qualities, ownership, and initiative Exhibit sound decision making and problem solving skills Are disciplined, self motivated, and capable of independent work Possess strong communication and technical documentation skills Selection Process 1. Resume project research profile shortlisting 2. Written technical assessment 3. Advanced technical interview Only candidates with strong technical depth, research aptitude, and professional maturity will be selected. Conversion to Full Time Role High performing interns may be offered a regular fulltime position at METATAARAKA AI INNOVATIONS PRIVATE LIMITED, subject to: Internship performance Position availability Clearing the final technical evaluation and interview Email: hr@mtai.in WhatsApp Queries: +91 79959 51590 Website: www.mtai.in This IITexclusive longterm RD internship offers a strong pathway into AI research, AI agents development, SaaS engineering, and enterprise AI systems, while working on realworld, highimpact problems alongside experienced professionals. Duration & Continuity The internship duration is one (1) year. Continuation is subject to consistent performance, adherence to timelines, and active participation. Publication timelines, authorship order, and disclosures will be governed by MetaTaaraka’s internal research and IP policies. Intellectual Property (IP) Rights All work, code, research outputs, models, datasets, documentation, and related intellectual property developed during the internship shall be the exclusive property of METATAARAKA AI INNOVATIONS PRIVATE LIMITED, unless explicitly stated otherwise in writing. Confidentiality & Data Security Interns must maintain strict confidentiality of: Proprietary information Client data Internal systems, codebases, and research Any breach of confidentiality or data misuse will lead to immediate termination and possible legal action. Unauthorized access, data sharing, or system misuse is strictly prohibited. Code of Conduct Professional behavior, ethical conduct, respectful communication, and compliance with organizational policies are mandatory throughout the internship. Termination Clause The company reserves the right to terminate the internship at any time, with or without notice, in case of: Unsatisfactory performance Policy violations Academic misrepresentation Misconduct or breach of trust Full-Time Employment Consideration Conversion to a regular full-time role is not guaranteed and is subject to: Internship performance Business requirements and vacancy availability Successful completion of final technical evaluation and interview No Academic Credit Guarantee Granting of academic credit, if required by the student’s institute, shall be subject to individual institute policies and is not guaranteed by the company.
